Row.Text: Central Bank

For every mutual [ICON_SWAP] Open Borders agreement, earn 5% (up to 100%) interest on current [ICON_GOLD] Gold Income. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in the [ICON_CAPTIAL] Capital City. Must have a Bank in all cities. The cost goes up the more cities are in the empire.

The Central Bank can generate a lot of extra gold for civilizations with good international relations. Like all National Wonders, the Central Bank increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

A central bank, reserve bank, or monetary authority is an institution that manages a state's currency, money supply, and interest rates. Central banks also usually oversee the commercial banking system of their respective countries. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In contrast to a commercial bank, a central bank possesses a monopoly on increasing the amount of money in the nation, and usually also prints the national currency, which usually serves as the nation's legal tender.
Central Terminal
+10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Owned tiles with a Road are instantly upgraded to a Railroad. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Requires a Factory in this and one other city.[ENDCOLOR]
+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from each Factory. Owned tiles with a Road are instantly upgraded to a Railroad. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires a Factory in every city.

The Central Terminal is especially useful for sprawling empires, as it instantly creates a rail network. The terminal also boosts production and gold in industrialized cities. Like all National Wonders, the Central Terminal increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

A "terminal" or "terminus" is a station at the end of a railway line. Trains arriving there have to end their journeys (terminate) or reverse out of the station. Many terminus stations have underground rapid-transit urban rail stations beneath, to transit passengers to the local city or district. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A terminus is frequently, but not always, the final destination of trains arriving at the station. However a number of cities, especially in continental Europe, have a terminus as their main railway stations, and all main lines converge on this station.
Hydroelectric Power Company

All cities on this continent receive Electric Power. Electric Power increases [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in its city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Must be built in a city on a river.[ENDCOLOR]

All cities on this continent receive Electric Power. Electric Power increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in its city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Must be built in a city on a river.[ENDCOLOR]

The Hydroelectric Power Company enhances the yields of all the cities on the continent where it is built. Like all National Wonders, the Power Company increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

Hydroelectricity is the term referring to electricity generated by hydropower; the production of electrical power through the use of the gravitational force of falling or flowing water. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It is the most widely used form of renewable energy, accounting for 16 percent of global electricity generation â€“ 3,427 terawatt-hours of electricity production in 2010, and is expected to increase about 3.1% each year for the next 25 years.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Electric Power[ENDCOLOR]
This city is receiving electricity from the Hydroelectric Power Company

Electric power is provided to all cities on the same continent as the Hydroelectric Power Company, a National Wonder. Electrified cities receive boosts to [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.

Electric power is usually produced by electric generators, but can also be supplied by sources such as electric batteries. It is generally supplied to businesses and homes by the electric power industry through an electric power grid. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Electric power is usually sold by the kilowatt hour (3.6 MJ) which is the product of power in kilowatts multiplied by running time in hours. Electric utilities measure power using an electricity meter, which keeps a running total of the electric energy delivered to a customer.
National Military Academy

Great Generals spawn 20% faster. Free Arsenal in this city. +15 [ICON_WAR] XP and +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all Land Units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Requires an Armory in every city.[ENDCOLOR]

Build a National Military Academy when pursuing a ground war, as it allows you to produce better units, faster. It also speeds the appearance of Great Generals, but the cadets will consume 2 [ICON_FOOD] Food, slowing city growth. Like all National Wonders, the Military Academy increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

A military academy or service academy (in American English) is an educational institution which prepares candidates for service in the officer corps of the army, the navy, air force or coast guard, which normally provides education in a service environment, the exact definition depending on the country concerned. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Three types of academy exists: high school-level institutions awarding academic qualifications, university-level institutions awarding bachelor's degree level qualification, and those preparing officer cadets for commissioning into the armed services of the state.
National Naval Academy

A free Great Admiral appears in the city upon completion. +15 [ICON_WAR] XP and +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all Sea Units. Grants the Seamanship Promotion to each naval unit produced in this city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Requires a Seaport in the city.[ENDCOLOR]

Build a National Naval Academy when pursuing a war at sea, as it allows you to produce stronger naval units, faster. It also gives a Great Admiral. Like all National Wonders, the Naval Academy increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

A naval academy or service academy (in American English) is an educational institution which prepares candidates for service in the officer corps of the army, the navy, air force or coast guard, which normally provides education in a service environment, the exact definition depending on the country concerned. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Three types of academy exists: high school-level institutions awarding academic qualifications, university-level institutions awarding bachelor's degree level qualification, and those preparing officer cadets for commissioning into the armed services of the state.
Seamanship
+25% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength VS. Naval Units.
National Air Force Academy

+15 [ICON_WAR] XP and +25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for all Air Units. Increases the air unit capacity of this city by 6. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Requires a Military Academy in the city.[ENDCOLOR]

Build a National Air Force Academy when pursuing a war in the skies, as it allows you to produce stronger air units, faster. Like all National Wonders, the Air Force Academy increases in cost with the number of cities in the Empire.

An air academy or service academy (in American English) is an educational institution which prepares candidates for service in the officer corps of the army, the navy, air force or coast guard, which normally provides education in a service environment, the exact definition depending on the country concerned. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Three types of academy exists: high school-level institutions awarding academic qualifications, university-level institutions awarding bachelor's degree level qualification, and those preparing officer cadets for commissioning into the armed services of the state.
